AT STAKE.Definition: in danger of being lost, at risk

PLEADED.Definition: made requests in an intense or emotional way

DRIBBLED.Definition: took the ball forwards past opponents by repeated light kicks

ELIMINATED.Definition: excluded from the rest of the tournament, disqualified

SHRUG IT OFF.Definition: ignore it or treat it as something not important

BLOW OFF SOME STEAM.Definition: release negative emotions by having fun

TRIGGER.Definition: the part of the gun that causes the gun to fire when pressed

ALLEGED.Definition: one said to have done it

WHISTLE.Definition: a high sound made by forcing air through the mouth or a device

PROTESTED.Definition: expressed a strong complaint or objection

GESTURING.Definition: moving their hands to show or express something, signalling

GESTURED.Definition: moved his hands to show or express something, signalled

CAPTAINED.Definition: was the leader of the team

ANTICIPATION.Definition: feeling of excitement about what was about to happen

HEAD BUTTED.Definition: hit him using the front of his head

TROPHY.Definition: the prize of the winner, the cup

BRIBERY.Definition: the act of giving them money in order to do something illegal for them

MATCH-FIXING.Definition: the action of dishonestly arranging the outcome of a match before it was played

BACKROOM DEALS.Definition: secret deals made in a dishonest way

SYMBOLIC.Definition: important because of what was being represented

HANDBALL.Definition: touching of the ball with the hand

HEADBUTT.Definition: an attack using the front of the head

POLITICALLY CHARGED.Definition: filled with political emotion or tension

HOSTS.Definition: the country that organised the tournament

INFLAMING.Definition: making them stronger or more intense

BACK TO BACK.Definition: following one after the other, consecutive

THE OFFSIDE RULE.Definition: a football rule concerning the allowed position of the attacking players when the ball is passed
